extraction_text: K perplexity Case Study: Analyzing 30% Profit Dip at a Ride- Hailing Startup in India Main Takeaways: The 30% profit dip in the last quarter is primarily driven by a sharp increase in customer churn, high cancellation rates, lower active driver retention, and external cost pressures (notably rising fuel prices and intensified competition). Addressing these issues requires targeted, data-driven interventions across operations, product, and customer experience. Step-by-Step Approach for Profit Dip
